AdrProperties.description: The properties of an ADR instance.

encryptInternalTraffic.description: The setting to enable or disable encryption of internal Traffic.

internalCerts.description: Certificate rotation and private key configuration.

AkriInstanceProperties.description: The properties of an AKRI instance.

state.description: This determines if the AKRI service is enabled.

cache.description: Enable caching of the authorization rules.

rules.description: The authorization rules to follow. If no rule is set, but Authorization Resource is used that would mean DenyAll.

principals.description: Give access to clients based on the following properties.

redundancyFactor.description: The desired numbers of backend replicas (pods) in a physical partition.

workers.description: Number of logical backend workers per replica (pod).

maxMessages.description: Maximum number of messages in a batch.

ports.description: Ports on which this listener accepts client connections.

serviceType.description: Kubernetes Service type of this listener.

cardinality.description: The cardinality details of the broker.

diagnostics.description: Spec defines the desired identities of Broker diagnostics settings.

diskBackedMessageBuffer.description: Settings of Disk Backed Message Buffer.

generateResourceLimits.description: This setting controls whether Kubernetes CPU resource limits are requested. Increasing the number of replicas or workers proportionally increases the amount of CPU resources requested. If this setting is enabled and there are insufficient CPU resources, an error will be emitted.

BrokerResourceRule.description: Broker Resource Rule properties. This defines the objects that represent the actions or topics, such as - method.Connect, method.Publish, etc.

method.description: Give access for a Broker method (i.e., Connect, Subscribe, or Publish).

clientIds.description: A list of client IDs that match the clients. The client IDs are case-sensitive and must match the client IDs provided by the clients during connection. This subfield may be set if the method is Connect.

topics.description: A list of topics or topic patterns that match the topics that the clients can publish or subscribe to. This subfield is required if the method is Publish or Subscribe.

duration.description: Lifetime of certificate. Must be specified using a Go time.Duration format (h|m|s). E.g. 240h for 240 hours and 45m for 45 minutes.

renewBefore.description: When to begin renewing certificate. Must be specified using a Go time.Duration format (h|m|s). E.g. 240h for 240 hours and 45m for 45 minutes.

CertManagerCertificateSpec.description: Automatic TLS server certificate management with cert-manager

duration.description: Lifetime of certificate. Must be specified using a Go time.Duration format (h|m|s). E.g. 240h for 240 hours and 45m for 45 minutes.

secretName.description: Secret for storing server certificate. Any existing data will be overwritten. This is a reference to the secret through an identifying name, not the secret itself.

renewBefore.description: When to begin renewing certificate. Must be specified using a Go time.Duration format (h|m|s). E.g. 240h for 240 hours and 45m for 45 minutes.

san.description: Additional Subject Alternative Names (SANs) to include in the certificate.

maxSessionExpirySeconds.description: Upper bound of Session Expiry Interval, in seconds.

maxMessageExpirySeconds.description: Upper bound of Message Expiry Interval, in seconds.

maxPacketSizeBytes.description: Max message size for a packet in Bytes.

subscriberQueueLimit.description: The limit on the number of queued messages for a subscriber.

maxReceiveMaximum.description: Upper bound of Receive Maximum that a client can request in the CONNECT packet.

maxKeepAliveSeconds.description: Upper bound of a client's Keep Alive, in seconds.

CloudEventAttributeType.description: How to map events to the cloud.

Components.description: The configuration for components of the AIO Instance.

adr.description: The properties of the ADR instance.

akri.description: The properties of the AKRI instance.

connectors.description: The properties of the connectors instance.

dataflows.description: The properties of the dataflows instance.

schemaRegistry.description: The properties of the device provisioning instance.

ConnectorInstanceProperties.description: The properties of a  Connector instance.

state.description: This determines if the Connector service is enabled.

DataLakeStorageAuthMethod.description: DataflowEndpoint Data Lake Storage Authentication Method properties

description.description: A user provided optional description of the dataset.

schemaRef.description: The reference to the schema that describes the dataset. Allowed: JSON Schema/draft-7.

inputs.description: List of fields for enriching from the Broker State Store.

expression.description: Condition to enrich data from Broker State Store. Example: $1 < 0 || $1 > $2 (Assuming inputs section $1 and $2 are provided)

description.description: A user provided optional description of the filter.

inputs.description: List of fields for filtering in JSON path expression.

expression.description: Condition to filter data. Can reference input fields with {n} where n is the index of the input field starting from 1. Example: $1 < 0 || $1 > $2 (Assuming inputs section $1 and $2 are provided)

description.description: A user provided optional description of the mapping function.

inputs.description: List of fields for mapping in JSON path expression.

expression.description: Modify the inputs field(s) to the final output field. Example: $1 * 2.2 (Assuming inputs section $1 is provided)

output.description: Where and how the input fields to be organized in the output record.

serializationFormat.description: Serialization format. Optional; defaults to JSON. Allowed value JSON Schema/draft-7, Parquet. Default: Json

schemaRef.description: Reference to the schema that describes the output of the transformation.

datasets.description: Enrich data from Broker State Store. Dataset references a key in Broker State Store.

filter.description: Filters input record or datapoints based on condition.

endpointRef.description: Reference to the Endpoint CR. Can be of Broker, Kafka, Fabric, ADLS, ADX type.

dataDestination.description: Destination location, can be a topic or table name. Supports dynamic values with $topic, $systemProperties, $userProperties, $payload, $context, and $subscription.

saslType.description: Type of SASL authentication. Can be PLAIN, SCRAM-SHA-256, or SCRAM-SHA-512.

audience.description: Audience of the service account. Optional, defaults to the broker internal service account audience.
Audience of the service to authenticate against. Optional; defaults to the audience for Service host configuration.

clientId.description: Client ID for the user-assigned managed identity.

scope.description: Resource identifier (application ID URI) of the resource, affixed with the .default suffix.

secretRef.description: Secret reference of the X.509 certificate.

authentication.description: Authentication configuration. NOTE - only authentication property is allowed per entry.

host.description: Host of the Azure Data Explorer in the form of <cluster>.<region>.kusto.windows.net .

batching.description: Azure Data Explorer endpoint batching configuration.

DataflowEndpointDataExplorerAuthenticati.description: Azure Data Explorer Authentication properties. NOTE - only authentication property is allowed per entry.

authentication.description: Authentication configuration. NOTE - only authentication property is allowed per entry.

host.description: Host of the Azure Data Lake in the form of <account>.blob.core.windows.net .

batching.description: Azure Data Lake endpoint batching configuration.

DataflowEndpointDataLakeStorageAuthentic.description: Azure Data Lake endpoint Authentication properties.  NOTE Enum - Only one method is supported for one entry

authentication.description: Authentication configuration. NOTE - only one authentication property is allowed per entry.

names.description: Names of the workspace and lakehouse.

oneLakePathType.description: Type of location of the data in the workspace. Can be either tables or files.

host.description: Host of the Microsoft Fabric in the form of https://<host>.fabric.microsoft.com.

DataflowEndpointFabricOneLakeAuthenticat.description: Microsoft Fabric endpoint. Authentication properties. NOTE - Only one method is supported for one entry

authentication.description: Authentication configuration. NOTE - only authentication property is allowed per entry.

copyMqttProperties.description: Copy Broker properties. No effect if the endpoint is used as a source or if the dataflow doesn't have an Broker source.

compression.description: Compression. Can be none, gzip, lz4, or snappy. No effect if the endpoint is used as a source.

kafkaAcks.description: Kafka acks. Can be all, one, or zero. No effect if the endpoint is used as a source.

partitionStrategy.description: Partition handling strategy. Can be default or static. No effect if the endpoint is used as a source.

values.name: Default
values.description: Default: Assigns messages to random partitions, using a round-robin algorithm.

values.name: Static
values.description: Static: Assigns messages to a fixed partition number that's derived from the instance ID of the dataflow.

maxBytes.description: Maximum number of bytes in a batch.

maxMessages.description: Maximum number of messages in a batch.

values.description: Default: Assigns messages to random partitions, using a round-robin algorithm.

values.name: Static
values.description: Static: Assigns messages to a fixed partition number that's derived from the instance ID of the dataflow.

authentication.description: authentication properties. DEFAULT: kubernetes.audience=aio-mq-internal. NOTE - Enum field only property is allowed

clientIdPrefix.description: Client ID prefix. Client ID generated by the dataflow is <prefix>-TBD. Optional; no prefix if omitted.

host.description: Host of the Broker in the form of <hostname>:<port>. Optional; connects to Broker if omitted.

keepAliveSeconds.description: Broker KeepAlive for connection in seconds.

retain.description: Whether or not to keep the retain setting.

maxInflightMessages.description: The max number of messages to keep in flight. For subscribe, this is the receive maximum. For publish, this is the maximum number of messages to send before waiting for an ack.

DataflowEndpointMqttAuthentication.description: Mqtt endpoint Authentication properties. NOTE - only authentication property is allowed per entry.

serviceAccountTokenSettings.description: Kubernetes service account token authentication. Default audience if not set is aio-mq-internal

endpointRef.description: Reference to the Dataflow Endpoint resource. Can only be of Broker and Kafka type.

assetRef.description: Reference to the resource in Azure Device Registry where the data in the endpoint originates from.

serializationFormat.description: Content is a JSON Schema. Allowed: JSON Schema/draft-7.

schemaRef.description: Schema CR reference. Data will be deserialized according to the schema, and dropped if it doesn't match.

dataSources.description: List of source locations. Can be Broker or Kafka topics. Supports wildcards # and +.

maxSize.description: The max size of the message buffer on disk. If a PVC template is specified using one of ephemeralVolumeClaimSpec or persistentVolumeClaimSpec, then this size is used as the request and limit sizes of that template. If neither ephemeralVolumeClaimSpec nor persistentVolumeClaimSpec are specified, then an emptyDir volume is mounted with this size as its limit. See <https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes/#emptydir> for details.

ephemeralVolumeClaimSpec.description: Use the specified persistent volume claim template to mount a "generic ephemeral volume" for the message buffer. See <https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/ephemeral-volumes/#generic-ephemeral-volumes> for details.

persistentVolumeClaimSpec.description: Use the specified persistent volume claim template to mount a persistent volume for the message buffer.

ExtendedLocation.description: Extended location is an extension of Azure locations. They provide a way to use their Azure ARC enabled Kubernetes clusters as target locations for deploying Azure services instances.

name.description: The name of the extended location.

ExtendedLocationType.description: The enum defining type of ExtendedLocation accepted.

Frontend.description: The desired properties of the frontend instances of the Broker

replicas.description: The desired number of frontend instances (pods).

workers.description: Number of logical frontend workers per instance (pod).

cpu.description: The toggle to enable/disable cpu resource limits.

identity.description: The managed service identities assigned to this resource.

InstanceProperties.description: The properties of the Instance resource.

provisioningState.description: The status of the last operation.

schemaRegistryNamespace.description: The reference to the Schema Registry for this AIO Instance.

components.description: The configuration for components of the AIO Instance.

apiGroup.description: APIGroup is the group for the resource being referenced. If APIGroup is not specified, the specified Kind must be in the core API group. For any other third-party types, APIGroup is required.

kind.description: Kind is the type of resource being referenced

name.description: Name is the name of resource being referenced

namespace.description: Namespace is the namespace of the resource being referenced. This field is required when the resource has a namespace.

ListenerPort.description: Defines a TCP port on which a `BrokerListener` listens.

authenticationRef.description: Reference to client authentication settings. Omit to disable authentication.

authorizationRef.description: Reference to client authorization settings. Omit to disable authorization.

nodePort.description: Kubernetes node port. Only relevant when this port is associated with a `NodePort` listener.

port.description: TCP port for accepting client connections.

protocol.description: Protocol to use for client connections.

tls.description: TLS server certificate settings for this port. Omit to disable TLS.

apiGroup.description: APIGroup is the group for the resource being referenced. If APIGroup is not specified, the specified Kind must be in the core API group. For any other third-party types, APIGroup is required.

kind.description: Kind is the type of resource being referenced

name.description: Name is the name of resource being referenced

ManagedIdentity.description: System and Use Assigned Managed Identity properties

logs.description: Diagnostic log settings for the resource.

metrics.description: The metrics settings for the resource.

prometheusPort.description: The prometheus port to expose the metrics.

otlpGrpcEndpoint.description: The open telemetry collector endpoint to export to.

intervalSeconds.description: How often to export the metrics to the open telemetry collector.

otlpGrpcEndpoint.description: The open telemetry collector endpoint to export to.

intervalSeconds.description: How often to export the metrics to the open telemetry collector.

OperatorValues.description: Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

attributes.description: A list of key-value pairs that match the attributes of the clients. The attributes are case-sensitive and must match the attributes provided by the clients during authentication.

clientIds.description: A list of client IDs that match the clients. The client IDs are case-sensitive and must match the client IDs provided by the clients during connection.

usernames.description: A list of usernames that match the clients. The usernames are case-sensitive and must match the usernames provided by the clients during authentication.

logs.description: Diagnostic log settings for the resource.

metrics.description: The metrics settings for the resource.

ProvisioningState.description: The enum defining status of resource.

SchemaRegistryInstanceProperties.description: The properties of a Schema Registry instance.

state.description: This determines if the Schema Registry service is enabled.

mode.description: The toggle to enable/disable self check.
The toggle to enable/disable self tracing.

ServiceType.description: Kubernetes Service Types supported by Listener

values.name: ReadWrite
values.description: Allowed all operations on Store - Get/KeyNotify/Set/Delete

keyType.description: Allowed keyTypes pattern, string, binary. The key type used for matching, for example pattern tries to match the key to a glob-style pattern and string checks key is equal to value provided in keys.

keys.description: Give access to state store keys for the corresponding principals defined. When key type is pattern set glob-style pattern (e.g., '*', 'clients/*').

method.description: Give access for `Read`, `Write` and `ReadWrite` access level.

SubscriberMessageDropStrategy.description: The enum defining strategies for dropping messages from the subscriber queue.

SubscriberQueueLimit.description: The settings of Subscriber Queue Limit.

length.description: The maximum length of the queue before messages start getting dropped.

strategy.description: The strategy to use for dropping messages from the queue.

TlsCertMethod.description: Collection of different TLS types, NOTE- Enum at a time only one of them needs to be supported

mode.description: Mode of TLS server certificate management.

certManagerCertificateSpec.description: Option 1 - Automatic TLS server certificate management with cert-manager.

manual.description: Option 2 - Manual TLS server certificate management through a defined secret.

limits.description: Limits describes the maximum amount of compute resources allowed. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/

requests.description: Requests describes the minimum amount of compute resources required. If Requests is omitted for a container, it defaults to Limits if that is explicitly specified, otherwise to an implementation-defined value. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/

volumeName.description: VolumeName is the binding reference to the PersistentVolume backing this claim.

volumeMode.description: volumeMode defines what type of volume is required by the claim. Value of Filesystem is implied when not included in claim spec. This is a beta feature.

storageClassName.description: Name of the StorageClass required by the claim. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#class-1

accessModes.description: AccessModes contains the desired access modes the volume should have. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#access-modes-1

dataSource.description: This field can be used to specify either: * An existing VolumeSnapshot object (snapshot.storage.k8s.io/VolumeSnapshot) * An existing PVC (PersistentVolumeClaim) If the provisioner or an external controller can support the specified data source, it will create a new volume based on the contents of the specified data source. If the AnyVolumeDataSource feature gate is enabled, this field will always have the same contents as the DataSourceRef field.

dataSourceRef.description: Specifies the object from which to populate the volume with data, if a non-empty volume is desired. This may be any local object from a non-empty API group (non core object) or a PersistentVolumeClaim object. When this field is specified, volume binding will only succeed if the type of the specified object matches some installed volume populator or dynamic provisioner. This field will replace the functionality of the DataSource field and as such if both fields are non-empty, they must have the same value. For backwards compatibility, both fields (DataSource and DataSourceRef) will be set to the same value automatically if one of them is empty and the other is non-empty. There are two important differences between DataSource and DataSourceRef: * While DataSource only allows two specific types of objects, DataSourceRef allows any non-core object, as well as PersistentVolumeClaim objects. * While DataSource ignores disallowed values (dropping them), DataSourceRef preserves all values, and generates an error if a disallowed value is specified. (Beta) Using this field requires the AnyVolumeDataSource feature gate to be enabled.

resources.description: Resources represents the minimum resources the volume should have. If RecoverVolumeExpansionFailure feature is enabled users are allowed to specify resource requirements that are lower than previous value but must still be higher than capacity recorded in the status field of the claim. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#resources

selector.description: A label query over volumes to consider for binding.

matchExpressions.description: MatchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

matchLabels.description: MatchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

values.description: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

secretRef.description: Kubernetes secret containing an X.509 client certificate. This is a reference to the secret through an identifying name, not the secret itself.
